metadata.title: CVE-2021-29955 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A transient execution vulnerability, named Floating Point Value Injection(FPVI) allowed an attacker to leak arbitrary memory addresses and may havealso enabled JIT type confusion attacks. (A related vulnerability,Speculative Code Store Bypass (SCSB), did not affect Firefox.). Thisvulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 78.9 and Firefox < 87.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29955` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 87.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 87.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 87.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 87.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '87.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52 package in esm-infra/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
